alert.note: Alert for Plumas (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 25 at 4:32PM PDT until June 25 at 9:00PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Areas of flooding possible due to heavy rainfall... * WHERE...Portions of the eastern perimeter of the Dixie Wildfire burn scar extending into the Genesee Valley. * WHEN...Until 630 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas due to burn scar runoff. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 426 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Genesee Valley. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory for a recent burn area means that flooding and/or debris flows are possible. Residents living in or immediately downstream of burn areas should maintain awareness for potential flooding and debris flows. Monitor conditions and emergency management communications. If flooding and/or debris flows are observed, move to a safe area away from the flooding.
